title: The Futurists - EPS_287: The Other Side of The Future with Cory Doctorow

and uh tell us a little bit about book
PSS and shovels and then how does that
fit into that scheme sure I would say
I'm actually three things I'm an
activist as well I've worked with ef the
Electronic Frontier Foundation for 23
years now um so pixs and shovels is a
science fiction novel it's the third
novel starring my forensic accountant
two-fisted hero Martin Hench whose story
is that he spends 40 years in Silicon
Valley unwinding every weird Finance
scam that a tech row can imagine he's
the zelig of high-tech Finance crime uh
I wrote this book under weird
circumstances the first of these Martin
Hench novels it was called red team
Blues it came out in 2023 and I I wrote
it during lockdown uh I write when I'm
anxious so during lockdown I sat in my
backyard hammock in Los Angeles and
wrote nine books and this was one of wow
uh and I sent it to my editor and uh the
next morning he sent me back a a very
short email that said uh that was a ride
wo and he bought three of them and the
this novel had a very odd premise I I
had the idea that you could write the
last volume of a long running Series
without bothering to write the rest of
the series uh and that that would that
would carry over a certain kind of
anticipatory energy you know so I think
you could do this with TV too I'd love
to see a a weekly show that was just the
last episode of a sitcom that didn't
exist uh different you know sort of that
that final episode of mash energy every
week so I wrote this book my editor
loved it he bought two more and I had to
figure out what to do because Marty
Hench in that book is 67 years old he's
got his one last job he you know earns
his retirement let's put it that way and
while there is some precedent for taking
a a detective out of retirement you you
have uh Conan Doyle bringing uh homes
back over Rick andb Falls but that was
cuz Queen Victoria told him she'd Knight

your editor is like a vice president of
the McMillan company he cannot offer you
a Knighthood but I had this idea that I
could write these books in any order
that because this guy had been in

the tale of any scam and there would be
a place for Marty Hench in it and that
moreover when you're writing out a
sequence uh you don't have to worry
about about continuity right if there's
something that doesn't seem to line up
you just write a book it between the two
points that reconciles them uh in fact
the more stuff you make up the more of a
premeditated you seem to be because
you're just pulling it all together so
it makes for it makes for very
satisfying read which brings me to pixs
and shoves this is the third of these
books and it's Marty hench's first
Adventure it's set during the Wild and
weird era of the early PC uh in the
early 1980s Marty Hench starts his
career as a prototypical MIT screw-up he
he flunks out of his computer science

programming computer computers to get a

Rockstar programmer roommate out to

of these weird PC companies is actually
a pyramid scheme it's called Fidelity
Computing it's run by a Mormon Bishop an
orthodox Rabbi and a Catholic priest and
they uh do predatory Faith sales where
they they work through their
parishioners to exploit one another
exploit the bonds of trust between them
to sell these junky PCS that are
designed to lock you in and pick your
pocket so like even things like the
fanfold paper for the tractor feed
printers have the tractor feed holes
sprocketed just slightly wider than
normal paper so you have to buy their
paper at a 10x multiple to print out
your documents and the floppy drives are
gimmick to take their special poy do I
basically it's the Apple model but in
the 1980 right it's the Mac model but in
the 1980 don't tell don't give Apple any
more ideas man you know it's like so the
the Rival company is called Computing
freedom and it was founded by three tear
away employees three former sales
managers one is an orthodox woman who's
been kicked out of her family because uh
she came out as lesbian one is a Mormon
woman who's left the faith because of uh
the uh LDS opposition to the Equal
Rights Amendment and and uh one is a nun
who's left her order and joined up with
The Liberation theology movement in
Central America during the Dirty Wars
and they've made it their mission to
repent of their sins and liberate all
the parishioners they locked into these
crappy PCS by building interoperable
hardware and software things that let
you export your data use anyone's floppy
drive use anyone's printers and so on
and so on and it turns out that the kind
of uh clerics who are willing to make
millions of dollars by exploiting uh
people in their faith group are not
going to go easily and in fact are not
above spectacular acts of violence to
defend their multi-million dollar grift
and so what starts is a commercial
battle turns into a shooting war and
it's all set in this moment where
Reaganomics neoliberalism the
dismantling of competition law they're
all kicking into gear and the stuff that
leads inexorably to today's in ification
to the degradation of the internet into
five giant websites filled with
screenshots of text from the other four
where it's just getting started and so
it's a way
to do historical fiction that works in
the way that maybe futuristic fiction
does too as a kind of toy world where
